events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their vehicle and another car on Main Street. Damage appears significant on the front bumper and hood.
The claim has been categorised under Auto Accident following analysis of the reported keywords and damage details from the insured.
An agent has been assigned to manage and investigate the auto accident claim promptly to ensure a smooth claims process.
The insured received acknowledgment of their claim submission with details on the next steps and expected timelines for resolution.
Request for additional documents including photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and driver statements has been sent to the claimant.
The claimant has submitted all requested documentation, including detailed photographs and official police collision report.
Investigation into the cause and fault of the auto accident has commenced, focusing on evidence from documents and damage assessment.
The investigation concluded with determination of liability and verification of damages sustained by the insured’s vehicle.
A fair settlement offer has been proposed to the insured based on investigation findings and estimated repair costs.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the responsiveness and professionalism during the claims process so far.
The insurer has approved the claim for repair expenses in full following acceptance of the settlement proposal by the claimant.
Payment has been issued covering all approved repair costs directly to the authorized repair shop as agreed in the claim.
The claim has been officially closed after successful payment and confirmation of vehicle repairs completed to the insured’s satisfaction.
All claim documents and records have been archived in the system for future reference and compliance after claim closure.
